glossdef.para: The deviation from the true population statistics of calculated sample statistics (e.g. flood frequency distribution parameters); with the relatively small size of the flood series (samples) typically available for Flood Frequency Analysis, sampling variability can be a significant source of uncertainty in design flood estimates.

The process of adjusting a data series (e.g. a flood data series) by one or two selected statistics of the at site distribution to render it homogeneous and dimensionless (e.g. for the case of the Index Method by dividing each data point by the index variable).

A standard method of pooling data for regional analysis if the data from different stations in a region can be assumed to be independent; the total number of station years in the pooled data set is therefore simply the sum of the record lengths at all the individual stations (or the number of stations times the average length of record) .
